highlights:
Here is a summary of recent news and events that could influence a decision to buy or sell SPY stock:
- The SPDR S&P 500 ETF Trust (SPY) closed at $508.26 on 04/26/24, up 0.95% from the previous day.
- Big Tech earnings have powered the S&P to its best week since October 2023.
- Barclays has noted an uptick in recession fears.
- Goldman has commented on megacap tech's performance.
- The Fed is expected to cut rates, but it is unclear when this will happen.
- BofA clients retracted $2B last week as the S&P dropped.
- The Dow Jones Industrial Average closed more than 200 points higher on 04/21/24, and the S&P 500 snapped a 6-day losing streak as tech stocks surged.
- The SPDR S&P 500 ETF is an exchange-traded fund that holds all the companies that make up the S&P 500.
- Warren Buffett believes that the best investment for most people is an S&P 500 index fund, and his company Berkshire Hathaway owns such funds.

Here is some recent news relating to the stock symbol XLC:
- XLC's highest ETF price in the past 12 months was $83.58.
- As of April 16, 2024, the AUM of XLC is 17.71B.
- Wall Street analysts have stated that XLC's price is currently undervalued.
- XLC is a major ETF that is home to stocks such as Meta and Disney.
- Meta, Netflix, and Para were among the top S&P500 communication movers in Q1.

Within the past week, there has been news of the completion of the conversion of over $123 million of principal and interest under the 4.00% unsecured convertible debenture of Auxly Cannabis Group Inc. (XLY.TO). The company has also amended its amended and restated investor rights agreement dated July 6, 2021.

In other news, Citi has downgraded the tech sector from Overweight to Market Weight and upgraded the consumer discretionary sector to Overweight. This could be seen as a positive indicator for XLY as the market is said to be 'evolving away from tech and cyclical leadership'.

Here is some recent news relating to the stock symbol XLP:
- The S&P 500 had its best Q1 in five years, driven by rate cut bets and megacap gains.
- The S&P 500 soared to the best week of 2024 after the Fed reignited a Wall Street rally.
- The Consumer Staples Select Sector SPDR ETF declared a quarterly distribution of $0.5522.
- The 2023 holiday season proved to be robust for US consumer spending, with consumer confidence rising. However, with many economic headwinds to weather in 2024, questions arise around the status of consumer spending going forward.

Here is a summary of news and events from the past week that may influence a buy/sell decision for the stock symbol XLE:

- Energy stocks, including XLE, soared in March, with the Energy Select Sector SPDR Fund (XLE) up about 11% for the month. This surge was attributed to rising oil prices, fuelled by concerns about supply and Russia's output cuts.
- Truist upgraded the energy sector to overweight as technicals improved, indicating a positive outlook for XLE.
- The US restricted oil and gas drilling across Alaska's North Slope in a new regulation, which could impact XLE's performance.
- Oil prices could face increased uncertainty, according to TD Securities, potentially affecting XLE's performance.
- Goldman Sachs began shifting away from the tech sector, which could impact XLE as investors seek alternative investment opportunities.
- The Dow Jones Industrial Average jumped 500 points on Wednesday, with the S&P 500 and Nasdaq Composite also gaining, after Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell ruled out a rate hike, easing investor worries about inflation.
- Regional bank stocks surged 2.5% on Wednesday, with the SPDR S&P Regional Banking ETF (KRE) up 4%, following the Federal Reserve's decision to maintain interest rates.
- Short interest in the "Magnificent Seven" stocks, including Alphabet, Amazon, Apple, Microsoft, Meta Platforms, Nvidia, and Tesla, climbed to a record $127 billion in April, indicating high investor interest in these tech stocks.
- The recent market pullback is considered a "normal pullback" by Charles Schwab's Kevin Gordon, suggesting that the current market conditions are not cause for significant concern.
- Goldman Sachs' Peter Oppenheimer recommends investors diversify their portfolios with exposure to both quality growth and deep value stocks, including the energy sector.

Here is some recent news relating to the stock symbol XLF:
- The S&P 500 slumped more than 4% in April, ending a five-month winning streak due to inflation concerns.
- 15 out of 23 financial stocks delivered EPS wins, with stable consumer demand.
- BofA saw clients retract $2 billion last week as the S&P dropped.
- CleanSpark topped the week's financial gainers, while Coinbase fell the most.
- Wall Street's April pullback intensified as the S&P 500 had its worst week in over a year.
- 15 out of 20 S&P 500 financial stocks delivered EPS wins, and a rebound in investment banking aided major U.S. banks.

I was unable to find any recent news relating to XLV stock within the past week. However, I did find some older news stories that may still be relevant to your buy/sell decision:

- XLV seeks to replicate the total return of the Consumer Services Select Sector of the S&P 500 Index.
- XLV's investment objective is to provide investment results that correspond generally to the price and yield performance of the S&P Health Care Select Sector Index.
- XLV had a strong 2022, but healthcare stocks are stumbling out of the gate in 2023.
- The Biden administration has issued a new ruling against junk health insurance.

I was unable to find any news relating to the stock symbol XLI in the past week. However, here is some general information about XLI that may be relevant to your buy/sell decision:

- XLI is an exchange-traded fund (ETF) that tracks a market-cap-weighted index of industrial-sector stocks drawn from the S&P 500.
- XLI provides investors with broad US industrial exposure, selecting companies from industry groups such as capital goods, commercial and professional services, and transportation.
- XLI has a Morningstar Fund Comparison tool that can be used to compare its performance with other funds.
- XLI has a Gross Expense Ratio of 0.09% as of April 24, 2024.
- XLI's top holdings as of April 23, 2024, include UBER TECHNOLOGIES INC, HONEYWELL INTERNATIONAL INC, and UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CL B.
I was unable to find any recent news relating to the stock symbol XLB. Can I help you with something else?

In the past week, there have been a few events that may influence a buy/sell decision for XLRE:

- Real estate stocks finished in the green as analysts turned positive and earnings surprised to the upside.
- Wall Street's April pullback intensified as the S&P 500 notched its worst week in over a year.
- Rents hold the key in core inflation cooling and the Fed's rate moves, according to BNP Paribas.
- Stocks tumbled on Thursday after the latest U.S. economic data showed a sharp slowdown in growth and pointed to persistent inflation.
- The Dow Jones Industrial Average slid 375.12 points, or 0.98%, to close at 38,085.80, weighed down by steep declines in Caterpillar and IBM. The S&P 500 and Nasdaq Composite also lost 0.46% and 0.64%, respectively.
- The GDP report showed the personal consumption expenditures price index increased at a 3.4% pace, raising concerns about persistent inflation and questioning the Federal Reserve's ability to cut rates anytime soon.

Here is some recent news relating to XLK:
- T. Rowe Price's Dom Rizzo says he is not worried about a near-term pullback in tech.
- Goldman Sachs has begun shifting away from the tech sector.
- First-quarter earnings reports are expected to show signs that other areas of the market could catch up to tech's growth later in 2024.
- 16 out of 20 information technology stocks delivered EPS wins this week.

Here is some recent news relating to the stock symbol XLU:
- Citi Equity Analyst Ryan Levine believes that AI is "the real emerging story" that will "create a demand growth for the industry at large."
- The Biden administration has imposed sweeping regulations on power plants.
- AI is set to overhaul the utilities market.
- The near-term outlook for the utility sector is not promising.
- Duke Energy was the least shorted utility stock in March.

Here is a summary of recent news relating to META that may influence a buy/sell decision:
- Meta's stock price has been on an uptrend, with 17 out of 19 weeks of upside movement.
- Meta is one of the "Magnificent Four" tech stocks, along with Nvidia, Microsoft, and Amazon, that continue to spearhead gains.
- Meta gets billions from China without the headaches many U.S. companies face there.
- Meta's Q1 earnings preview: there are questions about whether ad growth can keep up with AI spending.
- Mark Zuckerberg announced that Meta will offer its virtual reality OS to hardware companies, creating an iPhone versus Android dynamic.

Here is a summary of recent news and events relating to Amazon (AMZN) that may influence a buy/sell decision:

- Amazon's profits and cash flow have increased as its investments during the pandemic have paid off.
- Amazon's cloud computing headwinds are no longer a concern for analysts.
- Amazon's Q1 2024 earnings were solid, and some analysts consider it a 'buy'.
- Amazon is not paying dividends and is instead focusing on heavy capex spending.
- Amazon is going all-in on generative AI, calling it a 'multi-billion dollar business'.
- Amazon's AWS revenue climbed 17% year-over-year.
- Amazon's Zoox robotaxis will drive faster, farther, and at night in Las Vegas.
- Amazon's stock price as of April 23, 2024, was $155.18, with a 52-week range of $88.12 - $157.17.
- 89% of articles about AMZN in the last week were positive, compared to a sector average of 63%.
- Amazon's P/E ratio is 80.73 as of January 12, 2024.

Here is a summary of news relating to the stock symbol PG in the past week:

- Procter & Gamble has raised its dividend for the 68th consecutive year.
- The company reported a marginal increase in its net sales – a 1% increase of $20.2 billion in its 2024 third-quarter results.
- Procter & Gamble's stock price is predicted to increase by 4.40% from its latest price to $169.88 in the next 12 months.
- The company has recalled over 8 million Tide Pods and other laundry detergent packets due to safety concerns.

Here is a summary of recent news relating to Exxon Mobil Corporation (XOM) stock that may influence a buy/sell decision:
- California is set to conclude its probe into Exxon's plastic pollution.
- Exxon leads the industry fight against UN talks seeking a cap on plastic production.
- Exxon Mobil is worth more than Tesla.
- Goldman picks top capex and R&D stocks (including Exxon Mobil).
- Turkey is in talks with ExxonMobil over a multibillion-dollar LNG deal.
- ExxonMobil stock has a 24% upside, according to one Wall Street analyst.
- ExxonMobil is one of the world's top dividend payers.
- ExxonMobil stock was a good buy in 2022, but is it still?
- Oil prices are on the rise, and dividend giants like ExxonMobil are reaping the benefits.

Here is a summary of recent news and events that could influence a buy/sell decision for JPM stock:
- JPMorgan Chase & Co. (JPM) recently announced a dividend of $1.15 per share, payable on April 30, 2024.
- The company's stock price fell 6.5% after providing guidance that disappointed investors.
- JPMorgan's CEO, Jamie Dimon, stated that the U.S. economy is booming but warned of the potential negative consequences of fiscal dominance.
- The company's credit card charge-off rate improved in March.
- The average price target from 26 ratings is $193.53, with a 52-week range of $123.11 - $185.20.
- JPMorgan Chase is one of the largest and most complex financial institutions in the United States, with nearly $3.9 trillion in assets.

Here is a summary of recent news relating to LLY stock:

- LLY stock is not currently considered a buy. Shares recently fell below their 50-day line, which is considered a bearish sign.
- Eli Lilly's weight-loss drug, tirzepatide, has been successful in treating sleep apnea patients. The company is planning to ask global regulators to approve the drug for this use in mid-2024.
- Medicare announced it could pay for weight-loss drugs for some members, which caused a dip in Eli Lilly stocks.
- The company reported strong sales and earnings growth in the fourth quarter, with sales climbing 28% to top forecasts.
- Eli Lilly is working to gain approval for its Alzheimer's treatment, donanemab, which removes built-up plaque in the brain. The FDA has said it will hold an advisory committee meeting to discuss the drug's risks and benefits.
- The company has acquired Point Biopharma, an expert in radioligand treatments for cancer, and Versanis Bio, which has a drug that could improve fat loss while limiting muscle mass loss.

Here is a summary of recent news and events relating to GE stock:

- GE has finalised its split into three separate publicly traded companies: GE Aerospace (GE), GE Vernova (GEV), and GE HealthCare (GEHC).
- GE Aerospace is a global leader in designing, manufacturing, and servicing large aircraft engines. It earns most of its profits from the service revenue of its nearly 70,000 commercial and military engines.
- GE Vernova will focus on energy transition solutions, while GE HealthCare will develop medical technology.
- GE stock is up 38% year to date and has soared more than 89% in the past year.
- Out of 19 analysts on Wall Street, 13 rate GE stock a buy, 6 have a hold, and none have a sell.
- GE's aerospace business is benefiting from the recovery in commercial air travel after the pandemic, as well as growing defence orders.
- However, the aviation business is highly cyclical and faces risks from macroeconomic and geopolitical uncertainties.
- GE's price target has been raised by several analysts, including Argus, RBC Capital, Deutsche Bank, and BofA.
Linde plc (LIN) has been downgraded at Citigroup and UBS due to slower profit growth and valuation. The average price target from 30 ratings is $474.57.

Here is a summary of news and events from the past week relating to the stock symbol PLD (Prologis, Inc.):

- Prologis posted solid Q1 earnings but reduced its outlook, with management expecting some near-term headwinds to impact growth this year.
- Goldman Sachs maintained their buy rating on Prologis.
- Argus lowered their price target on Prologis to $120 from $139.
- Prologis stock underperformed on Thursday, February 29, when compared to competitors.
- Zacks.com users have been paying close attention to Prologis stock.

Based on this information, investors will need to make their own decisions about buying or selling Prologis stock, taking into account their investment strategies and risk tolerance.

Here is a summary of news relating to MSFT (Microsoft Corporation) from the past week:

- Microsoft reported better-than-anticipated Q3 earnings, powered by growth in its cloud products.
- Microsoft announced it will open its first regional data centre in Thailand, along with new cloud and AI infrastructure.
- Microsoft stock outperformed competitors on a strong trading day.
- Microsoft stock underperformed competitors on a Tuesday session.
- Microsoft is monetizing AI right now, according to an analyst.
- Microsoft stock rose by more than 2% after Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell ruled out a rate hike as the central bank's next move.

Here is a summary of news relating to NEE stock (NextEra Energy, Inc.) from the past week:

- NextEra Energy's Florida Power & Light (FPL) utility is the largest rate-regulated utility in Florida, distributing power to nearly 6 million customer accounts and owning 34 gigawatts of generation. FPL contributes roughly 70% of NextEra's consolidated operating earnings.
- NextEra Energy's renewable energy segment, NextEra Energy Resources, generates and sells power throughout the US and Canada with more than 30 GW of generation capacity, including natural gas, nuclear, wind, and solar.
- NextEra Energy's stock price target was raised to $67 from $61 at BofA.
- NextEra Energy sees 2026 adjusted EPS of $3.63-$4.00 and 2025 adjusted EPS of $3.45-$3.70, with a consensus of $3.68.
- Analysts offered insights on utility companies, including NextEra Energy, and maintained a Hold rating on the stock due to solid performance but limited upside.
